name: MacTeX
description: Most common LaTeX distribution for Mac OS X, basically TeXLive with some Mac-specific tools added.

name: TeX Live
description: Most common LaTeX distribution for Unices and Linux, but also works on Windows.

name: MikTeX
description: Most common LaTeX distribution for Windows (only).

name: pdfTeX
description: TeX compiler that produces PDF files immediately instead of DVI files (nowadays, this is the standard compiler for many users).

name: XeTeX
description: TeX compiler that provides better unicode and font support than TeX/pdfTeX (i.e. you can use the  fonts of your operating system instead of only TeX fonts).

name: LuaTeX
description: (La)TeX compiler that supports Lua code for scripting and has improved unicode and font support than standard TeX/pdfTeX.

name: MathJaX
description: JavaScript engine to render mathematical formulas on the web. The outcome looks really slick.

name: mimeTeX
description: mimeTeX is a rather old tool to render LaTeX formulas to PNG figures for your web site, without actually needing a LaTeX installation on your server.

name: mathTeX
description: mathTeX is the successor of mimeTeX: it produces nicer-looking images but it requires LaTeX to be installed on your server.

name: Kile
description: Just a great LaTeX editor originally from the Linux/KDE community, but runs just fine on Windows and OS X as well.

name: TeXMaker
description: Pretty good alternative to Kile.

name: TeXStudio
description: Cross-platform LaTeX editor that stems from TeXMaker.

name: WinEdt
description: The LaTeX editor many people swear by. Only for .

name: TeXnicCenter
description: A quite old but free and decent editor for LaTeX.

name: LyX
description: Cross-platform WYSIWYM editor that uses LaTeX behind the scenes to render documents.

name: TeXshop
description: No-nonsense editor for LaTeX documents which is included in MacTeX.

name: TeXWorks
description: No-nonsense editor for LaTeX code, modeled after TeXShop, but this one is cross-platform.

name: BakomaTex
description: Commercial LaTeX editor that allows to edit your document both using its source code and WYSIWYG.

name: Inlage
description: Commercial LaTeX editor with handwritten formula recognition, Excel importing and more nifty features.

name: LaTeXTools
description: An Atom port of the Sublime Text package of the same name.

name: LaTeXing
description: Commercial plug-in to edit LaTeX.

name: LaTeXTools
description: Free LaTeX plugin for Sublime Text.

name: AucTeX
description: Emacs plugin for LaTeX that also shows a preview of equations and figures.

name: LaTeX Live Preview
description: Instantly previews your LaTeX document.

name: Authorea
description: Online editor with built-in git support and bibliography tools.

name: ShareLaTeX
description: Has pretty great LaTeX documentation and simple version control.

name: Overleaf
description: Online editor, also with a WYSIWYM editor and git support.

name: Papeeria
description: Online editor with built-in git support.

name: JaxEdit
description: Online LaTeX editor with Live Preview and nice presentation mode.

name: JabRef
description: Very powerful cross-platform (Java) bibtex editor. The GUI looks quite dated, though.

name: Bibdesk
description: Great bibliography editor for .

name: Zotero
description: Reference manager for your browser that also exports to bibtex and integrates with many LaTeX editors.

name: Mendeley
description: Both an app and cloud client to manage your references and PDFs. Can sync out to a bibtex file for your LaTeX workflow.

name: Arara (GitHub repo)
description: Simple tool that allows you to specify which tools to call inside your document and it can be extended quite easily.

name: latexmk
description: Build tool that is the commonly used by many LaTeX editors (LaTeXing, TeXShop, ...) to build your LaTeX files.

name: Pandoc
description: This program converts almost any document format (LaTeX, DOC, markdown, ...) to almost any other format. A great tool to aid workflows where multiple formats are used.

name: Codecogs Eqn Editor
description: Online LaTeX equation editor that allows you to produce figures containing an equation.

name: LaTeXiT
description: LaTeXit is an equation editor that makes it easy to drag-and-drop rendered equations (as PDF, PNG, ...) into your non-LaTeX documents on the Mac.

name: KLaTeXFormula
description: Cross-platform alternative for LaTeXit.

name: EqualX
description: Graphical LaTeX formula editor.

name: ChkTeX
description: Linter / code checker for LaTeX documents.

name: TikzEdt (also:  GitHub repo)
description: WYSIWYG and text-based editor for TikZ pictures.

name: TikZ-Editor
description: Live-previewing editor for TikZ figures.

name: IPE
description: Drawing tool that integrates well with LaTeX commands and documents.

name: GeoGebra
description: Cross-platform geometry tool with output to TikZ.

name: Dia
description: Cross-platform diagramming tool that can export to PSTricks and MetaPost code.

name: CTAN
description: The Comprehensive TeX Archive Network is the place to look for useful packages and documentation.

name: Excel2LaTeX
description: Excel (2010 and older) macros to produce LaTeX tabular code.

name: csv2latex
description: Converts CSV files from your favorite programs to LaTeX tabulars.

name: Tables Generator
description: This website provides a graphical interface to input your table and produces properly-formatted code for LaTeX, Markdown, HTML, ...

name: pgfplotstable
description: This package dis­plays nu­mer­i­cal ta­bles rounded to de­sired pre­ci­sion in var­i­ous dis­play for­mats. It can even read CSV files to include directly in your LaTeX document.

name: TeXample
description: Blog about LaTex, with a big collection of TikZ figures.

name: LaTeX en SI
description: Useful website with some custom packages to draw special plots (Bode, Nyquist, electrical schematics, block schematics, ...) using TikZ. Note that everything is in French.

name: tkz
description: A collection of TikZ-based packages to make plots and graphs.

name: pgfplots
description: A truely awesome plotting library on top of and in the style of TikZ/pgf. This library can load in CSV data files, perform some calculations and create beautiful plots.

name: LaTeX templates
description: Collection of templates for papers, posters, resumés, theses, books, presentations, … for LaTeX.

name: HowtoTeX: templates
description: Different templates for LaTeX under a CC-NC-SA license.

name: Comprehensive LaTeX symbol list
description: A very extensive list of symbols for LaTeX. Available in A4 and letter sizes.

name: Detexify
description: You draw the symbol and this site/app will tell you the LaTeX command.

name: TUG
description: The TeX User Group is a way to get in touch with other (La)TeX users.

name: TeXDoc
description: Online interface to the texdoc utility to browse LaTeX packages and documentation.

name: Dickimaw Books: LaTeX resources
description: Great overview of resources useful for LaTeX.

name: TUG: TeX showcase
description: Website from the TUG that shows some examples of what LaTeX can do.

name: TeXample
description: Blog about LaTex, with a big collection of TikZ figures.

name: LaTeX cookbook
description: Sibling of TeXample, contains quite a bit of example code.

name: 12 Great resources for getting started with LaTeX
description: Nice overview of useful resources for beginners.

name: MartinThoma's LaTeX example
description: GitHub repository containing example LaTeX documents.

name: HowtoTeX LaTeX
description: Start page with useful resources for LaTeX users.

name: MacTeX Wiki: TeX Extras
description: Overview of useful tools for LaTeX. Many of them are specific for Mac, but quite a bit are useful for other platforms as well.

name: LaTeX community
description: Forum and blog about LaTeX.

name: The (Not So) Short Introduction to LaTeX2e
description: A very comprehensive introduction to LaTeX.

name: WikiBooks: LaTeX
description: The LaTeX wikibook. Not really a paper book, but it is equally extensive.

name: TeXblog
description: Blog about LaTeX and everything related.

name: Twitter: @TeXtip
description: Tips related to (La)TeX by John D. Cook.

name: TeX.StackExchange
description: StackExchange TeX section.
